column5: The journey begins tomorrow for another trip to Gold Pines Camp on Lac Seul. The anticipation has been building, and if I could I would spend the whole summer on that compound. What a privilege it is to be able to come up to such beauty and wonderful fishing as well as enjoying the fabulous hosts we have at camp. This year, my wife and I have the honor of taking my 10 year old grandson for his first trip to Canada. We have been tying spinner rigs together and talking techniques for weeks. He was so excited when we told him we were taking him to Canada that he jumped up and down for joy for ten minutes. It seems like all he has been asking us for the last month is when are we going; when are we going? Our nickname for each other is "Pal". It has been that way since he could talk. I can't wait to see his face as he brings in the eyes. I will always cherish this trip with my "Pal" and my special lady. Tight lines and safe travels to all.

Greetings,Someone once said to me that the business of life is making memories. It sounds to me that the original poster is well on his way of making special memories for himself, his wife and his pal.Good fishing and tight lines!!
Good for you. We are back from our trip north and miss it already. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
